misc-confusable-identifiers.description:
Description

Warn about confusable identifiers, i.e. identifiers that are visually close to
each other, but use different Unicode characters. This detects a potential
attack described in
CVE-2021-42574
.

Example:

int fo; // Initial character is U+0066 (LATIN SMALL LETTER F).
int ùêüo; // Initial character is U+1D41F (MATHEMATICAL BOLD SMALL F) not U+0066 (LATIN SMALL LETTER F).
misc-confusable-identifiers.option:
Static analysis (Clang-Tidy) options are configured via .clang-tidy file.

This rule has no specific options.
